<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Fed meeting: </strong></span><span>With interest rates already near zero, the central bank didn’t see any reason to tinker further. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/29/commerce-department-numbers-reveals-extent-firstquarter-damage-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pandemic’s Effect on the Economy: Like Pineapple on Pizza
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="America shrinking" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=454 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YQAhNVq0ggoDfGL6r9/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="America shrinking" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YQAhNVq0ggoDfGL6r9/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pretty much ruins it. Yesterday, <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/29/847468328/tip-of-the-iceberg-economy-likely-shrank-but-worst-to-come?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we got the numbers</a> for Q1 from the Commerce Department: GDP fell at a 4.8% annual rate, the first quarterly drop since 2014 and the worst quarterly drop since 2008. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The gory details </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pandemic took out consumer spending, business investment, imports, and exports like cans at a carnival booth. Pick your superlative—according to various commentators, this recession is “the worst in our lifetime,” “the worst in the post-World War II era,” and “the sharpest in the U.S. since the Great Depression.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Consumer spending plunged 7.6%, the most since 1980. It accounts for ~70% of GDP.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Services dropped the most on record, driven mostly by one industry: healthcare. The pandemic required providers to pull back on profit drivers like elective procedures and routine visits. Meanwhile, costs for extra equipment like PPE climbed. It all added up to mass layoffs. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>43,000 healthcare jobs were lost in March, per the Bureau of Labor Statistics. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nearly half of all medical practices have temporarily furloughed staff, while 22% have laid people off permanently, according to one survey. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s the bad news, here’s the worse news </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Q2. After all, things were mostly fine in Q1 until stay-at-home orders pulled the rug out mid-March. Next quarter, economists are projecting at least a 30% annual decline. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“We are going to see economic data for the second quarter that is worse than any data we have seen for the economy," Jerome Powell said yesterday. So basically we're looking at the worst economy ever. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some glimmers of hope:</strong> Most analysts expect a bounce-back starting in July as states lift restrictions. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said he anticipates a quick recovery over the summer as government relief funds work their magic. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But the Congressional Budget Office projected a more muted recovery in the second half of the year and a more sobering picture overall. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>We keep saying it...because it remains true. Any economic recovery depends on ramping up testing and tamping down infection rates.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/29/execs-dish-companys-earnings-reports?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Executives on the Record
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mark Zuckerbeg " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NjAvbWFya196dWNrZXJiZWcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><div>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/quintanomedia/46857789715/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mark Zuckerberg F8 2019 Keynote</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/quintanomedia/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Anthony Quintano</a>
</div></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span style="text-decoration: none;">In our never-ending quest to present earnings reports in interesting ways, we give you: quotes.</span><strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><span style="text-decoration: none;">Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none;">Reopening the country too soon will </span><span style="text-decoration: none;">“almost guarantee future outbreaks,” he said on an earnings call.</span><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none;">Despite that warning, Facebook reported a </span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/29/facebook-fb-earnings-q1-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strong quarter</a><span style="text-decoration: none;"> and said the ad market had stabilized after an initial drop-off. </span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><span style="text-decoration: none;">Tesla CEO Elon Musk: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none;">“To say that they cannot leave their house and they will be arrested if they do, this is fascist." On his earning call,</span><span style="text-decoration: none;"> Musk took pretty much the polar opposite attitude from Zuck re: lockdowns. Tesla’s earnings were less controversial—it scored its third straight </span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/29/tesla-tsla-earnings-q1-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quarterly profit</a><span style="text-decoration: none;">.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><span style="text-decoration: none;">Airbus CEO Guillaume Faury: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none;">“We are in the </span><a href="https://apnews.com/235ae13d1f1b1fde399d8025056fb2d1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gravest crisis</a><span style="text-decoration: none;"> the aerospace industry has ever known.” He also said the company is putting plans to reduce airplane emissions on the backburner.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson: </strong>“We have all been in our homes for six weeks, we have got a little stir-crazy,” he admitted to Bloomberg a day after the company reported a 10% drop in global sales. Which is why Johnson thinks people will be <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-29/starbucks-ceo-sees-stir-crazy-consumers-going-out-eventually?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eager to go out</a> as Starbucks begins to reopen U.S. stores.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/29/new-remdesivir-trial-gives-cause-optimism?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Remdesivir Is the Red Squiggly Line That Won't Go Away
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. Anthony Fauci added another loop de loop to the remdesivir roller coaster yesterday, offering an <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/29/health/gilead-sciences-remdesivir-covid-19-treatment/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">influential endorsement</a> of the promising coronavirus treatment from Gilead Sciences.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remarking on new findings from the National Institute for Allergy and Infectious Diseases, the country’s top infectious disease official said, "The data shows that remdesivir has a clear-cut, significant, positive effect in diminishing the time to recovery.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why Fauci is excited:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The results come from a randomized controlled trial in which </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/gilead-says-remdesivir-as-effective-treating-severe-covid-19-in-shorter-period-11588166509?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1,063 hospitalized patients</a></span><span> participated. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Coronavirus patients who took the drug recovered 31% faster than those taking the placebo—11 days compared to 15 days.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The proportion of patients who died was also lower (8% to 11.6%), however that's not a statistically significant difference. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/gilead-science-reports-positive-data-in-trial-of-remdesivir-as-treatment-for-covid-19-2020-04-29?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">separate study</a> also released yesterday, Chinese researchers found that the drug was “not associated with statistically significant clinical benefits.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why remdesivir matters: </strong>1) The FDA is likely to give emergency approval for the drug and 2) the markets react to any news about remdesivir in a big way. </p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re pretty sure California invented casual. Casual dining, casual conversation, casual attire—the terminator casually becoming governor. You get the idea.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So it’s no surprise that in 1964, <a href="https://www.seavees.com/pages/welcome-morning-brew-reader?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=paidcontent&utm_campaign=magnum" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SeaVees</a> pioneered casual footwear in California. How’d they kick it off? By blending <strong style="color:#000">the comfort of a sneaker with modern sophistication and timeless style</strong>,<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>resulting in a shoe suited for any occasion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In addition to the cult classics, we’ve been peepin’ their new <strong style="color:#000">Magnum Collection</strong> inspired by the 80s private eye series set in Hawaii.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.seavees.com/pages/welcome-morning-brew-reader?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=paidcontent&utm_campaign=magnum" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SeaVees</a> is actually <strong style="color:#000">the</strong> <strong style="color:#000">first footwear brand to be granted permission</strong> to use the same Hawaiian prints used in the show to complement one of the greatest mustaches of all time. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In other words, if you’re growing a casual quarantine ‘stache at the moment, these kicks would pair quite nicely.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.seavees.com/pages/welcome-morning-brew-reader?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=paidcontent&utm_campaign=magnum" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Here's a super chill 20% off</a>.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/29/spotifys-q1-report-reveals-insights-music-listening-habits?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Music to Spotify's Earnings
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Spotify said it hit <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/spotify-hits-130-million-subscribers-apple-music-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">130 million paying subscribers</a> in Q1, but like that ex who will call you after quarantine ends, music consumption has ~totally changed~ over the last few months.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Commutes go mute</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that most morning commuters wear slippers instead of seatbelts, Spotify reported a decline in usage of its car, wearable, and web platforms. But its TV and game console audiences grew more than 50%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We also got an update on Spotify's adventure into podcasts, highlighted by last quarter's $196 million acquisition of sports/culture content machine The Ringer—and its empire of 30+ pods. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">So far, so good: </strong></span><span>19% of monthly active users engaged with podcast content, up from 16% last quarter. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Searches for "chill" and "instrumental" playlists were also up, as two-in-five consumers reported listening to more music than usual to manage their stress. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Spotify’s Q1 places it alongside <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/netflix-subscribers-surge-like-crazy-as-coronavirus-traps-us-at-home/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">streaming buddy Netflix</a> as a rare bright spot in an otherwise dismal consumer environment.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/29/nearly-120-americans-will-soon-living-states-lockdowns-easing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">118 million Americans, or more than 33% of the country’s population, live in states that have either eased restrictions on nonessential businesses or plan to do soon, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/29/more-than-a-third-of-the-population-live-in-states-that-are-partially-reopened-or-will-be-soon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to CNBC</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It may be less exciting than it sounds. To comply with public health measures, restaurants will need to cap capacity and maintain distance between tables. Masks are required...everywhere. If you’re playing golf, you better not touch that pin.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To help you keep track of this quickly evolving situation, we’ve created a page that shows each state's timeline for loosening restrictions. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/29/us-states-reopening-economies?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check where your state stands</a>. </p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPandemic’s Effect on the Economy: Like Pineapple on Pizza\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"America shrinking\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=454 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/YQAhNVq0ggoDfGL6r9/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"America shrinking\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/YQAhNVq0ggoDfGL6r9/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePretty much ruins it. Yesterday, \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/29/847468328/tip-of-the-iceberg-economy-likely-shrank-but-worst-to-come?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewe got the numbers\u003c/a\u003e for Q1 from the Commerce Department: GDP fell at a 4.8% annual rate, the first quarterly drop since 2014 and the worst quarterly drop since 2008. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe gory details \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pandemic took out consumer spending, business investment, imports, and exports like cans at a carnival booth. Pick your superlative—according to various commentators, this recession is “the worst in our lifetime,” “the worst in the post-World War II era,” and “the sharpest in the U.S. since the Great Depression.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eConsumer spending plunged 7.6%, the most since 1980. It accounts for ~70% of GDP.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eServices dropped the most on record, driven mostly by one industry: healthcare. The pandemic required providers to pull back on profit drivers like elective procedures and routine visits. Meanwhile, costs for extra equipment like PPE climbed. It all added up to mass layoffs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e43,000 healthcare jobs were lost in March, per the Bureau of Labor Statistics. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNearly half of all medical practices have temporarily furloughed staff, while 22% have laid people off permanently, according to one survey. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat’s the bad news, here’s the worse news \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQ2. After all, things were mostly fine in Q1 until stay-at-home orders pulled the rug out mid-March. Next quarter, economists are projecting at least a 30% annual decline. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“We are going to see economic data for the second quarter that is worse than any data we have seen for the economy,\" Jerome Powell said yesterday. So basically we're looking at the worst economy ever. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome glimmers of hope:\u003c/strong\u003e Most analysts expect a bounce-back starting in July as states lift restrictions. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said he anticipates a quick recovery over the summer as government relief funds work their magic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut the Congressional Budget Office projected a more muted recovery in the second half of the year and a more sobering picture overall. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWe keep saying it...because it remains true. Any economic recovery depends on ramping up testing and tamping down infection rates.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eIn our never-ending quest to present earnings reports in interesting ways, we give you: quotes.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eFacebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg: \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eReopening the country too soon will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e“almost guarantee future outbreaks,” he said on an earnings call.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eDespite that warning, Facebook reported a \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/29/facebook-fb-earnings-q1-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrong quarter\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e and said the ad market had stabilized after an initial drop-off. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eTesla CEO Elon Musk: \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e“To say that they cannot leave their house and they will be arrested if they do, this is fascist.\" On his earning call,\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e Musk took pretty much the polar opposite attitude from Zuck re: lockdowns. Tesla’s earnings were less controversial—it scored its third straight \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/29/tesla-tsla-earnings-q1-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equarterly profit\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eAirbus CEO Guillaume Faury: \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e“We are in the \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/235ae13d1f1b1fde399d8025056fb2d1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egravest crisis\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e the aerospace industry has ever known.” He also said the company is putting plans to reduce airplane emissions on the backburner.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStarbucks CEO Kevin Johnson: \u003c/strong\u003e“We have all been in our homes for six weeks, we have got a little stir-crazy,” he admitted to Bloomberg a day after the company reported a 10% drop in global sales. Which is why Johnson thinks people will be \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-29/starbucks-ceo-sees-stir-crazy-consumers-going-out-eventually?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeager to go out\u003c/a\u003e as Starbucks begins to reopen U.S. stores.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDr. Anthony Fauci added another loop de loop to the remdesivir roller coaster yesterday, offering an \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/29/health/gilead-sciences-remdesivir-covid-19-treatment/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einfluential endorsement\u003c/a\u003e of the promising coronavirus treatment from Gilead Sciences.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRemarking on new findings from the National Institute for Allergy and Infectious Diseases, the country’s top infectious disease official said, \"The data shows that remdesivir has a clear-cut, significant, positive effect in diminishing the time to recovery.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy Fauci is excited:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe results come from a randomized controlled trial in which \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/gilead-says-remdesivir-as-effective-treating-severe-covid-19-in-shorter-period-11588166509?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1,063 hospitalized patients\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e participated. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCoronavirus patients who took the drug recovered 31% faster than those taking the placebo—11 days compared to 15 days.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe proportion of patients who died was also lower (8% to 11.6%), however that's not a statistically significant difference. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/gilead-science-reports-positive-data-in-trial-of-remdesivir-as-treatment-for-covid-19-2020-04-29?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eseparate study\u003c/a\u003e also released yesterday, Chinese researchers found that the drug was “not associated with statistically significant clinical benefits.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy
